_header: Heried and blessed must he be
Note:
See Singer (1928)
XSinger, Dorothea Waley. Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts. 3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31, 183.
_description: A concluding ascription to The Mirror of Light, a prose tract on ‘phylosoferys stonys and the perfytenes of tham’ — two couplets

CamTCC916.Transcription:
Heryyd and blessyd mote he beThat hyest ysin trenyteHere endys
                    the merowre of lytysThat bladythe all crystyn wytys Amen
CamTCC916.Editions:
Singer,  Dorothea Waley. 
             Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts.
         3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31: 1.160, 3.1134.

CamTCC1137.Transcription:
heried and blessid mote he bethat hiest isin trynitethus endeth
                    the mirror of lighteswhich glades all wightes

BLHar3542.Transcription: Herid be god & blessid mote he beThat heyist sit in triniteHere endit þe Myrrour of lyȝtenysThe wyche gladyth all Wyttes
BLHar3542.Note: At end of Latin version. Second occurrence in this manuscript.
BLHar3542.Editions:
Singer,  Dorothea Waley. 
             Catalogue of Latin and Vernacular Alchemical Manuscripts.
         3 vols. Brussels: Lamertin, 1928-31: 1.160, 3.1134.
